subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Introduction to Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
shortTitle: Intro to Elec Eng & Cpt Sci
description: Introduction to programs within the School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science discussing resources, opportunities, and knowledge and skills necessary to succeed within EECS majors.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite:  MATH 103 with a C or better, or higher level MATH course with a C or better, or a minimum ALEKS math placement score of 45%.
description: Elementary algorithmic problem solving, computational models, sequential, iterative and conditional operations, parameterized procedures, array and list structures and basic efficiency analysis.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite:  MATH 101 with a C or better, MATH 103 with a C or better, or higher level MATH course with a C or better, or a minimum ALEKS math placement score of 45%.
description: Elementary algorithmic problem solving, computational models, sequential, iterative and conditional operations, parameterized procedures, array and list structures and basic efficiency analysis.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: MATH 108, 171, 172, 182, 201, 202, 206, or 220, each with a C or better, CPT S 111 with a B+ or better, a min ALEKS math placement score of 78%, or by permission with an AP Exam in Cpt S Principles or Cpt Sci A with a 4 or better.
description: Formulation of problems and top-down design of programs in a modern structured language (C/C++) for their solution on a digital computer.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 121 with a C or better.
description: Advanced programming techniques: data structures, recursion, sorting and searching, and basics of algorithm analysis taught in C/C++ programming language.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: MATH 108, 171, 172, 182, 201, 202, 206, or 220, each with a C or better, CPT S 111 with a B+ or better, a min ALEKS math placement score of 78%, or by permission with an AP Exam in Cpt S Principles or Cpt Sci A with a 4 or better.
description: Formulation of problems and top-down design of programs in a modern structured language for their solution on a digital computer. Taught in Java programming language.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 131 with a C or better.
description: Advanced programming techniques: data structures, recursion, sorting and searching, and basics of algorithm analysis. Taught in Java programming language.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 122, CPT S 132, or CS 122.
description: Exploration of fundamental concepts, constructs, and techniques of modern data analytics systems. (Crosslisted course offered as CPT S 215, CS 215.)

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 122 with a C or better; MATH 216 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment.
description: Advanced data structures, object oriented programming concepts, concurrency, and program design principles taught in C/C++ programming language.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 122 with a C or better, or CPT S 132 with a C or better.
description: Debugging tools, scripting languages, UNIX programming tools.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 132 with a C or better; MATH 216 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment.
description: Advanced data structures, object oriented programming concepts, concurrency, and program design principles. Taught in Java programming language.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment, or CPT S 233 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment.
description: Computer systems architecture; logic, data representation, assembly language, memory organization and trends.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Professional Skills in Computing and Engineering
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233 with a C or better, OR CPT S 121 or 131 and E E 261 with C or better; admitted to a major in EECS or Data Analytics; junior standing.
description: Professional development; ethical and professional responsibilities in computing and engineering. (Crosslisted course offered as CPT S 302, E E 302.) Credit not granted for both CPT S/E E 302 and CPT S 401.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, 233, or CS 215, with a C or better; admitted to the major or minor in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Analytics, or Cybersecurity.
description: The process of automatically extracting valid, useful, and previously unknown information from large repositories. Recommended preparation: prior Python programming. (Crosslisted course offered as CPT S 315, CS 315.)

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 122 or 132, with a C or better; MATH 216 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Finite automata, regular sets, pushdown automata, context-free language, Turing machines and the halting problem.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Object-oriented programming for flexibility, efficiency, and maintainability; logic and UI decoupling; complexity analysis, data structures, and algorithms for industry-quality software.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, or 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics, or major in Neuroscience.
description: Introduction to software engineering; requirements analysis, definition, specification including formal methods; prototyping; design including object and function oriented design.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233, with a C or better; CPT S 322 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.  Enrollment not allowed if credit earned in CPT S 487.
description: Practical aspects of software design and implementation using object-oriented, aspect-oriented and procedural programming. Credit not granted for both CPT S 323 and 487.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Fundamentals of Cyber Security and Cryptography
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233 with a C or better; CPT S 260 or E E 234 with a C or better; CPT S 360 or 370 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment; MATH 216 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Security and privacy principles in modern computers and network communications covering various security protection mechanisms, including cryptography, secure communication protocols, and anonymity techniques.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, or 233, with a C or better; CPT S 317 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Analysis of data structures and algorithms; computational complexity and design of efficient data-handling procedures.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Design concepts of high-level programming languages; survey of existing languages, experience using some languages.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 with a C or better; CPT S 260 with a C or better or E E 234 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Implementation of systems programs, concepts of computer operating systems; laboratory experience in using operating system facilities taught in C/C++ programming language.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 233 with a C or better; CPT S 260 with a C or better or E E 234 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Implementation of systems programs, concepts of computer operating systems; laboratory experience in using operating system facilities. Taught in Java programming language.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, or 233; admitted to a major in EECS or Data Analytics; junior standing.
description: Skills and literacy course. Ethical and societal issues related to computers and computer networks; computers as enabling technology; computer crime, software theft, privacy, viruses, worms. Credit not granted for both CPT S 401 and CPT S/E E 302.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, or 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Fundamental principles of parallel computing, parallel programming experience on multicore machines and cluster computers, and design of algorithms and applications in parallel computing. Recommended preparation: CPT S 350.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, or 233, with a C or better; admitted to the major or minor in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Analytics, or Cybersecurity.
description: Big data models, databases and query languages, modern distributed database systems and algorithms. (Crosslisted course offered as CPT S 415, CS 415.)

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: C or better in each of CPT S 322; CPT S 360 or 370; one 400-level CPT S course taken at WSU; admitted to a major in EECS; senior standing.
description: Large-scale software development including requirements analysis, estimation, design, verification and project management.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 321 with a C or better or CPT S 323 with a C or better; CPT S 322 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Dependable software systems; software verification and validation, testing; CASE environments; software management and evolution.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 421 with a C or better; admitted to a major in EECS.
description: Laboratory/group design project for large-scale software development, requirements analysis, estimation, design, verification techniques.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Cyber Law, Ethics, Rights, and Policies
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Laws, ethics, rights, and governmental regulations as applied to the field of cybersecurity from technological and social perspectives.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Recovery and investigation of material found in various cyber environments (e.g., device, memory, operating systems, etc.) and ways to defeat forensic processes and tools.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Hardware, Hardware Security, and Hardware Reverse Engineering
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Hardware hacking and reverse engineering approaches routinely used against electronic devices and embedded systems; introduction to the basic procedures necessary to perform reverse engineering of hardware components to determine their functionality, inputs, outputs, and stored data.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Hardware, Hardware Security, and Hardware Reverse Engineering
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; CPT S 439 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Hardware hacking and reverse engineering approaches routinely used against electronic devices and embedded systems; introduction to the basic procedures necessary to perform reverse engineering of hardware components to determine their functionality, inputs, outputs, and stored data.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Cyber Security of Wireless and Distributed Systems
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Cellular and wireless system security, incidence response cycles, fault tolerance, and distributed computer security.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Key aspects of cyber security with an emphasis on software and systems security focusing on concepts, principles, methodologies, and techniques for measuring and defending the various security properties of both operating systems and application software. Credit not granted for both CPT S 428 and CPT S 528.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Virtualization and offensive cyber operations including the building of multiple software systems that operate as independent systems running on multiple native hardware items and conducting campaigns aimed at compromising computational capacities of an adversary.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: MATH 315 with a C or better; one of CPT S 121, 131, or MATH 300, with a C or better.
description: Fundamentals of numerical computation; finding zeroes of functions, approximation and interpolation; numerical integration (quadrature); numerical solution of ordinary differential equations. Required preparation must include differential equations and a programming course. (Crosslisted course offered as MATH 448, MATH 548, CPT S 430, CPT S 530.)  Credit not granted for more than one of MATH 448/548 or CPT S 430/530.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Security analytics at an enterprise deployment scale using social, data, graph avenues of evaluation, and topics of supply chain cybersecurity, risk management frameworks, and security of developer operation pipelines.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327; CPT S 427; CPT S 428; CPT S 455, each with a C or better; admitted to the major in Cybersecurity; senior standing.
description: Group design project for large-scale cybersecurity development incorporating analysis, application ability, industrial skills, and adherence to cybersecurity standards.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 121, 131, or E E 221, with a C or better; STAT 360 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics, or major in Neuroscience.
description: Hands-on experience with neural network modeling of nonlinear phenomena; application to classification, forecasting, identification and control. Credit not granted for both CPT S 434 and CPT S 534.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, or 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Topics in machine learning including linear models for regression and classification, generative models, support vector machines and kernel methods, neural networks and deep learning, decision trees, unsupervised learning, and dimension reduction. Recommended preparation: E E 221; linear algebra; multivariate calculus; probability and statistics.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233, with a C or better; CPT S 224 with a C or better; MATH 172 or 182, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Data taxonomy, sampling, plotting, using and extending a visualization package, designing visualization and domain-specific techniques.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 and admitted major or minor in CPT S, Software Engr, Cybersecurity, or Data Analytics; OR E E 234 and 361 and admitted major or minor in E E; OR CPT S 327 and E E 234 and admitted major or minor in Cpt Engr.
description: Security topics as they relate to critical infrastructure systems vital to any nation including industrial control systems, cyber physical systems, SCADA, DCS, IoT, IIoT, and the knowledge to secure such systems.  (Crosslisted course offered as E E 439, CPT S 439.)  Credit not granted for both E E/CPT S 439 and 539. Offered at 400 and 500 level.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 and admitted major or minor in CPT S, Software Engr, Cybersecurity, or Data Analytics; OR E E 234 and 361 and admitted major or minor in E E; OR CPT S 327 and E E 234 and admitted major or minor in Cpt Engr.
description: Security topics as they relate to critical infrastructure systems vital to any nation including industrial control systems, cyber physical systems, SCADA, DCS, IoT, IIoT, and the knowledge to secure such systems.  (Crosslisted course offered as E E 439, CPT S 439.)

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 327 and 426 with a C or better or concurrent enrollment; admitted major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics; OR E E 234 and 361; admitted major or minor in E E; OR CPT S 327 and E E 234; admitted major or minor in Cpt Engr.
description: Security topics as they relate to critical infrastructure systems vital to any nation including industrial control systems, cyber physical systems, SCADA, DCS, IoT, IIoT, and the knowledge to secure such systems.  (Crosslisted course offered as E E 439, CPT S 439.)

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics, or major in Neuroscience.
description: An introduction to the field of artificial intelligence including heuristic search, knowledge representation, deduction, uncertainty reasoning, learning, and symbolic programming languages. Credit not granted for both CPT S 440 and CPT S 540.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 with a C or better; CPT S 224 with a C or better or CPT S 360 with a C or better; MATH 220 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Raster operations; transformations and viewing; geometric modeling; visibility and shading; color. Credit not granted for both CPT S 442 and CPT S 542.
coopPhrase: Cooperative: Open to UI degree-seeking students.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223 or 233; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics, or major in Neuroscience; junior standing.
description: Concepts and methodologies of engineering, social and behavioral sciences to address ergonomic, cognitive, social and cultural factors in the design and evaluation of human-computer systems. Credit not granted for both CPT S 443 and CPT S 543.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, 223, or 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Introduction to database concepts, data models, database languages, database design, implementation issues.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 317 with a C or better; CPT S 355 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Design of lexical analyzers, syntactic analyzers, intermediate code generators, code optimizers and object code generators.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: MATH 220, 225, or 230.
description: Graphs and their applications, directed graphs, trees, networks, Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths, matrix representations, construction of algorithms. Required preparation must include linear algebra.  Recommended preparation: MATH 301. (Crosslisted course offered as MATH 453, CPT S 453.)
coopPhrase: Cooperative: Open to UI degree-seeking students.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: MATH 220, 225, or 230.
description: Graphs and their applications, directed graphs, trees, networks, Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths, matrix representations, construction of algorithms. Required preparation must include linear algebra.  Recommended preparation: MATH 301. (Crosslisted course offered as MATH 453, CPT S 453.)
coopPhrase: Cooperative: Open to UI degree-seeking students.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
longTitle: Introduction to Computer Networks and Security
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 360, 370, or E E 234, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Concepts and implementations of computer networks; architectures, protocol layers, internetworking, addressing case studies, and discussion of security constraints at all layers of the OSI stack from attacker and defender perspectives. (Crosslisted course offered as CPT S 455, E E 455.)

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
description: Formulation and solution of network optimization problems including shortest path, maximal flow, minimum cost flow, assignment, covering, postman, and salesman. Credit not granted for both MATH 466 and MATH 566. Required preparation must include linear programming. (Crosslisted course offered as MATH 466/566, CPT S 456/556.)
coopPhrase: Cooperative: Open to UI degree-seeking students.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 360 with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Operating systems, computer architectures, and their interrelationships in micro, mini, and large computer systems.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 223, 233, or E E 234, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: Concepts of distributed systems; naming, security, networking, replication, synchronization, quality of service; programming middleware. Credit not granted for both CPT S 464 and CPT S 564.
coopPhrase: Cooperative: Open to UI degree-seeking students.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.

coopPhrase: Cooperative: Open to UI degree-seeking students.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.

description: Fundamental algorithms, techniques and applications. Credit not granted for both CPT S 471 and CPT S 571.

subject: CPT_S
prefixDescription: With the exception of the Computer Skills and Literacy courses, enrollment in 300-400-level computer science courses is restricted to admitted majors or minors in EECS, and to juniors and seniors admitted to other degree programs requiring these computer science courses.
requisitePhrase: Course Prerequisite: CPT S 215, CPT S 223, or CPT S 233, with a C or better; admitted to a major or minor in EECS or Data Analytics.
description: The data science process, data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, linear regression, classification, clustering, principal components analysis, recommender systems, data visualization, data and ethics, and effective communication. Recommended preparation for 575: Familiarity with algorithm design and analysis, basic linear algebra, and basic probability and statistics. Credit not granted for both CPT S 475 and CPT S 575.

Recommended preparation: mathematical maturity at senior undergraduate level and some experience with computer programming. (Crosslisted course offered as MATH 529, CPT S 519.)

subject: CPT_S

subject: CPT_S

description: Key aspects of cyber security with an emphasis on software and systems security focusing on concepts, principles, methodologies, and techniques for measuring and defending the various security properties of both operating systems and application software. Credit not granted for both CPT S 428 and CPT S 528.

subject: CPT_S

Required preparation must include differential equations and a programming course. (Crosslisted course offered as MATH 448, MATH 548, CPT S 430, CPT S 530.)  Credit not granted for more than one of MATH 448/548 or CPT S 430/530.
